docs.title: ARKEO Multichannel API
docs.text:
Welcome to the ARKEO Multichannel API documentation.

This API allows programmatic control of the ARKEO multichannel measurement platform, including device channels, sensors, environments, and automation logic.

The documentation is organized to help you:

  • understand the API structure
  • discover available commands
  • integrate a client step by step

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
If you are new to the API, follow this recommended path:

  • Protocol

    Learn how commands and responses are exchanged, including message framing and transport rules.

    Protocol overview

  • Commands

    Explore all available commands, grouped by functional domain.

    Commands overview

  • JSON Objects

    Understand how channels, sensors, and settings are represented in JSON.

    JSON objects

docs.title: API structure at a glance
docs.text:
The API is organized around domains, each with a clear responsibility and response structure:

Domain Purpose Device Measurement channels and electrical control Sensors Physical and virtual sensors Environments Logical grouping of sensors Day–Night Automation and cycling logic

Each domain is documented separately and can be used independently.

docs.title: Who this documentation is for
docs.text:
This documentation is intended for:

  • client developers (Python, LabVIEW, C++, etc.)
  • system integrators
  • advanced users automating measurements

It focuses on clarity, consistency, and explicit behavior rather than tutorials or examples tied to a specific language.

docs.title: Looking for something specific?
docs.text:
• Want to control measurements? → Device commands
  • Need sensor values? → Sensor commands
  • Working with automation? → Day–Night
  • Integrating metadata? → JSON objects

Use the navigation menu on the left to jump directly to the relevant section.

Note

This documentation describes the API behavior, not a specific client implementation.

docs.title: v0.1
docs.text: Initial version

docs.title: v0.2
docs.text: Added ForceJV and GetChannelState

docs.title: v0.3
docs.text: Added GetLatestJV, GetIV and GetSensors

docs.title: v0.4
docs.text: Reorganized the settings JSON and clarified the documentation Added JSON schema validation

docs.title: v0.4.1
docs.text: Now allows multiple connections in parallel Added GetSensorsInfo command GetSensors now sends physical values instead of raw voltages GetSensors no longer sends all sensor channels, but only configured channels Index field in the settings JSON changed from string to integer

docs.title: v0.4.2
docs.text: Added GetEnvironments Added SetChannelEnvironment

docs.title: v0.4.3
docs.text: Added Day-Night object to json settings Added GetGlobalDayNight and SetGlobalDayNight

docs.title: v0.5.0
docs.text: New response protocol. Now follows a consistent structure. Device commands now include an indices fields to select channels Removed SetActiveChannel Removed GetActiveChannel Renamed StartChannel to StartMeasurement Renamed GetSensor to GetSensorData Renamed SetChannelEnvironment to SetDeviceEnvironment

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
The following sequence of commands can be used to perform a basic MPPT measurement. In this example, channels 0, 1 and 2 are configured and measured. Note that most device commands require the indices field.

{ "command": "GetIV"} //ensure IV channels are read correctly
{ "command": "SetChannelSettings", "indices":[0,1,2], "parameter": { ... JSON settings string ...}  }
{ "command": "GetChannelState", "indices":[0,1,2]} //Ensure settings are loaded. State should be "ready to start"
{ "command": "StartMeasurement"} //Ensure settings are loaded. State should be "ready to start"
{ "command": "GetChannelState", "indices":[0,1,2]} //Poll until "measurement" == "Tracking"
{ "command": "GetLatestJV", "indices":[0,1,2]} 
{ "command": "GetIV"} //Poll periodically during tracking phase to monitor device
{ "command": "StopChannel", "indices":[0,1,2]}

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
"GetIV" can be periodically polled in the background. It doesn't affect any device channels. It can be used as a sanity check to ensure that ADCs are running.

"SetChannelSettings" Can be used both before and during a measurement to change the settings of a channel. Note that any fields not included in the JSON are ignored and those settings will not be affected.

"GetChannelState" Use this to monitor the measurement state of the device. If no measurements are running, after applying settings, the "state" field will be "ready to start". Whereas, if a measurement was already running and another channel is added, the state will immediately go to "running".

"StartMeasurement" This command should only be called if no channels are currently running.

"GetChannelState" If tracking is not enabled, the channel will stop automatically after a JV

"GetLatestJV" Retrieves the JV scans as an array of all selected channels. Can be called during a JV to retrieve the incomplete scan.

"GetIV" Monitor the tracking state (voltage, current and power) with this command

docs.title: Protocol
docs.text: TBA

docs.title: API Commands
docs.text:
The ARKEO Multichannel API is organized into command domains. Each domain groups commands that operate on the same logical subsystem and share a common response structure.

Select a section below to explore the available commands.

  • Device Commands

    Commands that control measurement channels

    Response root: channels

    Open device commands

  • Sensor Commands

    Commands related to physical sensors, their configuration, and live values.

    Response root: sensors

    Open sensor commands

  • Environment Commands

    Commands for managing sensor environments

    Response root: environments

    Open environment commands

  • Day–Night Commands

    Commands controlling day–night cycling, automation logic, and thresholds.

    Response root: day_night

    Open day–night commands

docs.title: Command domain overview
docs.text:
Each command belongs to exactly one domain and returns a domain-specific payload.

Domain Description Response key Device Measurement channels and SMU control channels Sensors Physical sensors and readings sensors Environments Sensor grouping and associations environments Day–Night Global cycling and automation logic day_night

Clients should rely on the domain-specific response key when parsing results.

Design rule

Commands never mix multiple domains in a single response.

docs.title: Day-Night Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are related to the global Day-Night cycling.

Response root: day_night

docs.title: GetGlobalDayNight
docs.text:
Description Returns the global day-night cycling values and settings

Example Request 

{"command": "GetGlobalDayNight"}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "day_night":{
    "status":{
      "isDay":true,
      "DelayTimer":"2026-01-24T09:12:56.667Z",
      "Elapsed Time (s)":154.133176803589,
      "Sensor Value":100
    },
    "settings":{
      "enable":false,
      "sensor":0,
      "threshold_value":10,
      "threshold_duration":8,
      "night_algorithm":"Open Circuit",
      "night_jv":false
    }
  }
}

docs.title: SetGlobalDayNight
docs.text:
Description Set the global day-night cycling settings.

Example Request 

{
  "command":"SetGlobalDayNight",
  "parameter":{
    "settings":{
      "enable":true,
      "sensor":0,
      "threshold_value":10,
      "threshold_duration":8,
      "night_algorithm":"MPPT",
      "night_jv":false
    }
  }
}
Example Response 
{"status":"ok"}

docs.title: Device Commands
docs.text:
The following commands affect the SMU channels.

Response root: channels

docs.title: SetChannelSettings
docs.text:
Description Set the JSON configuration string for the active channel. See The JSON settings string for more details.

Example Request 

{
  "command": "SetChannelSettings",
  "indices":[0,1,2],
  "parameter": {
    "settings": "{... JSON settings string ...}"
  }
}

Example Response 

{ "status":"ok" }


{
  "status":"error",
  "error":{"code":5001,"message":"Invalid JSON"}
}

docs.title: GetChannelSettings
docs.text:
Description Retrieve the JSON configuration string of the active channel. See The JSON settings string for more details.

Example Request

{"command": "GetChannelSettings", "indices":[0,1,2]}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    { ... JSON settings string index i ...},
    { ... JSON settings string index i+1 ...}
  ]
}

docs.title: StartMeasurement
docs.text:
Description Start the measurement process.

Note

This command should only be used once to start the measurement process. If a channel is configured while a measurement is running, it will start automatically

Example Request 

{"command": "StartMeasurement"}
Example Response 
{ "status":"ok" }


{
  "status":"error",
  "error":{"code":5005,"message":"Already running"}
}

{
  "status":"error",
  "error":{"code":5006,"message":"No channel running, enable at least 1 channel"}
}

docs.title: StopChannel
docs.text:
Description Stop the measurement process for the selected channels.

Invalid command

If a channel is already stopped or is not enabled, no state change occurs. The "result" key will have the value "ignored"

Example Request 

{"command": "StopChannel", "indices":[0,1,2]}

Example Response 

{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    {
      "index":0,
      "enabled":true,
      "previous_state":"running",
      "new_state":"stopped",
      "result":"stopped"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: ForceJV
docs.text:
Description Force a JV measurement on the selected channels.

Example Request 

{"command": "ForceJV", "indices":[0,1,2]}

Example Response 

{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    {
      "index":0,
      "enabled":true,
      "state":"running",
      "measurement":"jv",
      "result":"ok"
    }
  ]
}

The ForceJV command is ignored if the channel is:

  • not enabled
  • not running
  • already in JV

In that case "result" will return "ignored", with an additional "reason" key stating one of the above reasons.

Example Response 

{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    {
      "index":0,
      "enabled":true,
      "state":"stopped",
      "measurement":"jv",
      "result":"ignored",
      "reason":"not running"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: GetChannelState
docs.text:
Description Retrieve the current state of the selected channels. See The JSON state string for more details.

Example Request 

{"command": "GetChannelState", "indices":[0,1,2]}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    {"index":0,"enable":true,"user":"Cicci Research","device":"Sample","measurement":"jv","direction":"forward","state":"running"}
  ]
}

docs.title: GetLatestJV
docs.text:
Description Retrieve the voltage and current values of the latest JV measurement as an array of JSON object. See: JV JSON object

Example Request 

{"command": "GetLatestJV", "indices":[0,1,2]}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "channels":[
    { ... JV JSON object 1 ... },
    { ... JV JSON object 2 ... },
    ...
  ]
}

docs.title: GetIV
docs.text:
Description Retrieve the live voltage and current values of all channels.

Example Request

{"command": "GetIV"}
Example Response

{
  "status":"ok",
  "schema":[
    {"name":"Voltage","unit":"V"},
    {"name":"Current","unit":"A"}
  ],
  "data":[
    [-8.52843206071149,-0.00816152902459247],
    [-7.57741630298776,-0.00708037023781523],
    [-6.40744244717755,-0.00580657492001222],
    ...
  ],
  "timestamp":"2026-01-24T09:14:09.685Z"
}

docs.title: SetDeviceEnvironment
docs.text:
Description Associate an environment to a device.

Example Request 

{
 "command":"SetDeviceEnvironment",
 "indices":[0,1,2],
 "parameters":{"environment":"env1"}
}
Example Response 
{"status":"ok"}

If an invalid environment name is provided, an error object is returned 

{
  "status":"error",
  "error":{
    "code":5002,
    "message":"Invalid Environment: indoor.\nUse 'GetEnvironments' to get a list of valid environment names."
  }
}

docs.title: Environment Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are related to the sensor environments.

Response root: environments

docs.title: GetEnvironments
docs.text:
Description Retrieve a list of all configured environments. "sensor_channels" contains an array of all associated sensor channels. Use the channel index from the Sensor JSON String to associate the channel to the correct sensor.

Example Request

{"command": "GetEnvironments"}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "environments":[
    {
      "name":"Env1",
      "sensor_channels":[0,1]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Sensor Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are related to the sensors.

Response root: sensors

docs.title: GetSensorsInfo
docs.text:
Description Retrieve sensor configuration (JSON with channels, names, types, units, and sensor-specific settings). See: Sensor JSON String for more details.

Example Request 

{"command": "GetSensorsInfo"}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "sensors":[
    {
      "model":"SHT3x-ARP Humidity",
      "common":{
        "group":"",
        "name":"Humidity",
        "channel":2,
        "type":"Humidity",
        "unit":"%",
        "origin":{
          "chamber":false,
          "external":false
        }
      },
      "specific":{
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: GetSensorsData
docs.text:
Description Retrieve the live values of all sensors. Use the channel index from the Sensor JSON String to associate the value to the correct sensor.

Example Request

{"command": "GetSensorsData"}
Example Response 
{
  "status":"ok",
  "schema":[
    {"name":"channel","type":"uint16"},
    {"name":"value","type":"float64"}
  ],
  "sensors":[
    [0,56.83]
    [1,23.56]
    [2,945.13]
  ]
}

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
import socket
import json
def exampleCommand(command, data=''):
    with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as sock:
        sock.connect(('localhost', 6340))
        message = json.dumps({'command': command, 'data': data})
        # Prepare the length of the string
        length = len(message)
        length_bytes = length.to_bytes(4, byteorder='big')  # 4 bytes to represent the length
        sock.sendall(length_bytes) # Send the length of the string
        sock.sendall(message.encode('utf-8')) # Send the string
        # Receive response
        response = sock.recv(1024)
        print('Received:', response.decode('utf-8'))
exampleCommand('GetChannelSettings')

docs.title: Environments JSON
docs.text:
The configured environments are retrieved as a JSON array. The sensors_id field contains an array of the included sensors. Cross-reference them with the Sensor JSON String. 

{
  "name":"Env1",
  "sensor_channels":[0,1]
}

docs.title: JV Scan
docs.text: The GetLatestJV command retrieves the latest JV scan acquired from the device under test, together with derived photovoltaic parameters.

docs.title: Response structure
docs.text:
{
  "user": "string",
  "device": "string",
  "area": {
    "value": number,
    "unit": "cm^2"
  },
  "time": "ISO-8601 timestamp",
  "data_schema": [ ... ],
  "parameter_schema": [ ... ],
  "scans": [ ... ]
}

docs.title: Top-level fields
docs.text: Field Type Description user string Operator or organisation performing the measurement device string Device or sample identifier area object Active device area time string Timestamp when the JV data was acquired (UTC, ISO‑8601) parameter_schema array Schema describing extracted JV parameters scans array List of JV scans (forward, reverse)

docs.title: Scans
docs.text:
Each entry in the scans array represents one JV scan.

{
  "name": "forward",
  "data_schema": [ ... ],
  "data": [ ... ],
  "parameters": { ... }
}

docs.title: Scan fields
docs.text: Field Type Description name string Scan identifier (forward, reverse) data_schema array Schema describing JV data columns data array JV data points following data_schema parameters object Extracted photovoltaic parameters (resolved form)

docs.title: Data schema
docs.text:
The data_schema defines the meaning and units of each column in the JV data arrays.

"data_schema": [
  { "name": "voltage", "unit": "V" },
  { "name": "current", "unit": "mA/cm^2" }
]

Each entry in a scan’s data array follows the same column order as defined in data_schema.

docs.title: JV data
docs.text:
JV data is provided as an array of numeric arrays for compactness and performance.

"data": [
  [ -0.10,  0.00012 ],
  [  0.00,  0.00011 ],
  [  0.30, -0.00002 ]
]

Each inner array corresponds to one measurement point:

[ voltage, current_density ]

The meaning and units of each column are defined by data_schema.

docs.title: Resolved parameters
docs.text:
Extracted parameters are provided as a resolved object with explicit units.

"parameters": {
  "voc":         { "value": 0.00290,  "unit": "V" },
  "jsc":         { "value": 0.32602,  "unit": "mA/cm^2" },
  "v_mpp":       { "value": 0.11531,  "unit": "V" },
  "j_mpp":       { "value": 0.21741,  "unit": "mA/cm^2" },
  "p_mpp":       { "value": 0.08436,  "unit": "mW/cm^2" },
  "r_series":    { "value": 764.41,   "unit": "Ohm" },
  "r_shunt":     { "value": 107060.3, "unit": "Ohm" },
  "fill_factor": { "value": 48.78,    "unit": "%" },
  "efficiency":  { "value": 1.834,    "unit": "%" }
}

docs.title: Sensor JSON Object
docs.text:
Sensors represent physical or virtual measurement inputs (e.g. temperature, humidity, irradiance) that are sampled independently from device channels.

Sensors are:

  • globally defined
  • uniquely identified by a channel index
  • referenced by other API components (environments, day-night logic)

docs.title: Sensor object structure
docs.text:
Each sensor is described by a JSON object composed of two parts:

  • model: The physical model of the sensor
  • common: generic metadata shared by all sensors
  • specific: sensor-dependent configuration fields
{
  "model": "SHT3x-ARP Humidity",
  "common": { ... },
  "specific": { ... }
}

docs.title: common (object)
docs.text:
"common": {
    "group": "Chamber",
    "name": "Humidity",
    "channel": 2,
    "type": "Humidity",
    "unit": "%",
    "origin": {
        "chamber": false,
        "external": false
}

The common object contains fields that are present for all sensor types.

Field Description Example Type group Logical group name "Chamber" string name Human-readable sensor name "Humidity" string channel Unique sensor identifier 2 integer type Sensor quantity type "Humidity" string unit Measurement unit "%" string origin Sensor origin metadata object object

docs.title: origin (object)
docs.text: Field Description Example Type chamber Sensor belongs to a chamber false boolean external Sensor is externally connected false boolean

docs.title: specific (object)
docs.text:
The specific object contains sensor-specific configuration fields.

  • Its content depends on the sensor model and type
  • It may be empty if no additional configuration is required
  • Its schema is not shared across sensor types
"specific": {
  "offset": 0.2,
  "calibration_date": "2025-10-01"
}

Clients should treat this object as opaque unless the sensor type is known.

docs.title: Sensor identity and indexing
docs.text:
Each sensor is uniquely identified by its channel field.

"channel": 2

This index is used consistently across the API:

Usage Field Sensor configuration common.channel Live sensor data GetSensorsData → sensors[][0] Environments sensor_channels[] Day-Night logic sensor

docs.title: Relation to sensor data (GetSensorsData)
docs.text:
Live sensor values are returned separately from the sensor definition.

{
  "schema":[
    {"name":"channel","type":"uint16"},
    {"name":"value","type":"float64"}
  ],
  "sensors":[
    [2, 56.83]
  ]
}

To associate a value with a sensor: 1. Read the channel index 2. Match it with common.channel from the sensor definition

docs.title: Design rules
docs.text:
Design principles

  • Sensor definitions are static (configuration)
  • Sensor data is dynamic (measurements)
  • Commands never mix configuration and live data in the same response

docs.title: JSON Settings string
docs.text:
The settings of a channel are represented in a JSON string. When using SetChannelSettings, this is value that the software expects. It is not required to provide the full JSON. Any fields not included in the JSON are ignored and those settings will not be affected.

Below is an example of a channel settings string. 

{
  "Enable":false,
  "User":"User",
  "Device":"Sample",
  "Channel":{
    "VoltageLimit":"10 V",
    "CurrentLimit":0,
    "Inverted":false
  },
  "JV":{
    "Vmin (V)":-0.1,
    "Vmax (V)":0.5,
    "Step (mV)":20,
    "ScanRate (mV/s)":200,
    "VocDetect":true,
    "Overvoltage (%)":10,
    "ScanOrder":"FW then RV"
  },
  "Tracking":{
    "TrackEnable":true,
    "Algorithm":"MPPT",
    "Perturbation (V)":0.02,
    "ConstantOutput":0.2,
    "SaveInterval (s)":10,
    "jvInterval":{"Value":1,"Unit":"min"},
    "TestDuration":{"Value":100,"Unit":"hours"}
  },
  "Cell":{
    "Type":"Cell",
    "Area (cm2)":1,
    "NrCells":1
  },
  "Day-Night":{
    "Use Global":false,
    "Settings":{
      "enable":true,
      "sensor":2,
      "threshold_value":50,
      "threshold_duration":5,
      "night_algorithm":"Open circuit",
      "night_jv":false
    }
  },
  "Light":{"Irradiance":100,"Unit":"mW/cm2"},
  "Note":""
}

docs.title: Parameter Description
docs.text: The following sections provides details of each parameter.

docs.title: Top-level meta-data
docs.text: Parameter Description Example Unit Type Enable Enables or disables the channel true — boolean User Name of the user User — string Device Device name Sample — string

docs.title: Channel (object)
docs.text:
Parameter Description Example Unit Type VoltageLimit¹ Maximum voltage 10 V V string CurrentLimit Current range 0 — integer InvertedStructure Inverts the applied voltage false — boolean ¹ Voltage Limit

The voltage limit of each board is 10 V. 20 V can be reached by connecting two boards in series and wiring the positive contacts to the device and the negative contacts together.

docs.title: JV (object)
docs.text:
Parameter Description Example Unit Type Vmin (V) Minimum voltage -0.1 V float Vmax (V) Maximum voltage 2 V float Step Voltage increment per step 20 mV integer ScanRate (mV/s) Rate at which voltage is applied 100 mV/s float VocDetect Enable open-circuit detection true — boolean ScanOrder² Order of scanning FW then RV — string ² ScanOrder enum

FW then RV RV then FW Forward only Reverse only

docs.title: Tracking (object)
docs.text:
Parameter Description Example Unit Type TrackEnable Enables tracking true — boolean Algorithm³ Algorithm used for tracking MPPT — string Perturbation (V) Voltage differential for tracking 0.01 V float ConstantOutput Maintain a constant output 0.2 * float SaveInterval (s) Time between saved data points 10 s integer jvInterval.Value Time between JV scans 10 — float jvInterval.Unit⁴ Unit for JV interval min — string TestDuration.Value Duration of tracking test 100 — float TestDuration.Unit⁴ Unit for test duration hours — string ³ Tracking Algorithm options

MPPT Open circuit Short circuit Fixed Voltage Fixed Voltage (no track) Fixed Current

⁴ Time Unit options

seconds minutes hours

docs.title: Cell (object)
docs.text:
Parameter Description Example Unit Type Type⁵ Cell type Cell — string Area (cm2) Area of the cell 1 cm² float NrCells Number of cells 1 — integer ⁵ Cell Type options

Cell Parallel Module Z Module W Module

docs.title: Day-Night (object)
docs.text:
Parameter Description Example Unit Type Use Global Use the global settings false — boolean enable Enable the day-night cycling true — boolean sensor Channel of the sensor 1 — integer threshold_value Threshold between day and night 50 — float threshold_duration Delay after threshold is reach 5 min float night_algorithm Algorithm during night time Open-circuit — string night_jv Perform JV during night time false — boolean Note

The settings object is ignore if the "Use Global" is enabled

docs.title: Note
docs.text: Parameter Description Example Unit Type Note Free-to-use field for comments — — string

docs.title: The JSON state string
docs.text:
The state of a channel is represented in a JSON string. This string is read-only and is obtained using the GetChannelState command.

Below is an example of a state string. 

{
    "index":0,
    "enable":false,
    "user":"Cicci Research",
    "device":"Sample",
    "measurement":"jv",
    "direction":"forward",
    "state":"running"
}

Description

Parameter Description Example Data Type index Channel index 0 Integer enable If channel is enabled true Boolean user Name of the user User String device Name of the device Sample String measurement State of the Measurement jv1 String direction Current direction of the JV forward2 String state Current state of the channel running3 String

  1. Options: jv, tracking ↩

  2. Options: forward, reverse ↩

  3. Options: idle, ready to start, running, stopped, error ↩
